title: Instructional Design Based on Experimental Condition Comparison for Developing Scientific Reasoning Skills

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced theoretical knowledge and mastery of high-level application skills
context.additional_context: Strengthening experimental data analysis and report-writing skills in environments where digital devices can be utilized

learning_goals: Learners can systematically compare experimental conditions by applying the scientific inquiry cycle (OPIRR: Observe, Predict, Investigate, Reflect, Revise).

Over a 2â€“4 week mid-term course, learners solve ten or more complex mathematical problems in engineering calculations and statistical modeling provided by vocational training institutions. Using analytical (problem decomposition, pattern identification) and integrative (multiconcept connection) approaches, they document step-by-step solutions meeting four or more of five criteria in a scientific reasoning rubric (logical consistency, evidence, error analysis, computational accuracy, interpretation).
Learners can visualize experimental results and derive logical conclusions using digital tools.

resources: Experimental Equipment with Real-Time Data Collection Capability

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
